required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Using Micronised Progesterone (Crinone® 8%) in the Luteal Phase Support of Women Undergoing in Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) and Embryo Transfer (ET)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Randomized, Comparative, Phase III Study Using Micronised Progesterone (Crinone® 8%) in the Luteal Phase Support of Women Undergoing in Vitro Fertilization and Embryo Transfer (IVF/ET)

brief_summary.textblock: This was an open-label, randomized, comparative, phase III study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Crinone 8% in comparison with progesterone 60 mg intramuscular (i.m.) administered once a day in luteal phase support in 200 Chinese female subjects undergoing IVF/ET.

detailed_description.textblock: This was an open-label, randomized, comparative, multicentric, phase III study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Crinone 8% in comparison with progesterone 60 mg intramuscular administered once a day in luteal phase support in Chinese female subjects undergoing IVF/ET. The study planned to enroll 200 female subjects who underwent pituitary down-regulation as per each center's normal practice prior to and during stimulation of multiple follicular development. The progesterone administration was started on the day of ET. Randomisation was performed on the day of ET. If pregnancy was confirmed on day 14 of the progesterone administration, the progesterone was continued for another 45 days. The subjects were followed up and the treatment outcome (negative pregnancy test or pregnancy) was recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: The difference in hCG positive rate in the two arms 14 days after embryo transfer
The difference in pregnancy rates in the two arms 30 and 60 days after embryo transfer
The difference in implantation rate in the two arms 30 days after embryo transfer

arm_group.description: Female subjects undergoing IVF/ET treated with Crinone 8% intravaginally
Female subjects undergoing IVF/ET treated with 60 mg progesterone intramuscularly once daily

intervention.description: Micronised progesterone administered intravaginally once daily from the day of ET. If pregnancy was confirmed on day 14 of progesterone administration, progesterone was continued for another 45 days.
Progesterone 60 mg administered intramuscular once daily from the day of ET. If pregnancy was confirmed on day 14 of progesterone administration, progesterone was continued for another 45 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has given written informed consent
- BMI < 25 kg/m2
- Age < 36 years
- <3 prior ART cycles (IVF, ICSI and related procedures)
- Infertility
- Regular spontaneous ovulatory menstrual cycles
Exclusion Criteria:
- Habitual abortion
- Hydrosalpinges
- History of past poor response to COH
- Patients with serious arterial, lung, hepatic and renal diseases
- Hepatic and renal impairment

responsible_party.organization: Serono Singapore, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany.
